page.title: 10UNI.OF LONDON OBSERVATORY
page.content: The Observatory was opened in 1929 and stands beside the A1 (A41) at Mill Hill. The building houses various telescopes used by students on a rota basis both for observation and operational training. The main telescopes are a 1974 24" Reflector called the 'Allen',after a past director,and a 1901 18" and 24" Double Refractor called the 'Radcliffe' which came from Radcliff College, Oxford. Both of the telescopes can be kept on the path of the star under observation by electronic control. There is also an 8" Refractor called the 'Fry' made in 1862 and a 6"Refractor called the 'Joysons' made in 1863.Both of these have clockwork gravity driven mechanical controls. There is an annex at Daws Lane which houses the computing facilities.
